trans-unit.source: No sliders where found. Create a new one by choosing one of this options:
Create a new slider by hand
Create a new slider with the wizard

The php configuration "max_input_vars" seems very low. If you create a slider with many slides and layers this can cause some unexpected errors on. Please increase the max_input_vars in php.ini or with htacces to 4000 or above.
The php configuration "max_input_vars" is lower than this request need. You slider was not updated at all. Please check the slider and increase the php "max_input_vars".
Warning: This slider is not compatible with the version 6 of this extension. Please click here to start the update process now
Name of the slider. Save the slider after your input. You will be redirected to manage the slider.
Create a new slider with the wizard
You can select the preferred type of the slider you wish to create
Use this slider type, if the slider should be embedded in your layout. The width of the slider is at least the same width of your content.

Use this slider type, if the slider should be in full width mode. In this mode, you need a layout, that provide a area where the width is not set to a maximum width. The slider has always the same width as the browser window.
Create a slider that fits the browser width and height. Background images are set on mode "cover". The slider resizes width the window.
Go back to list (no save, configuration lost!)

Each image represents one slide. You can add as many images you need. For the best results make sure, that each image has the same resolution as each other.

If your content area has a width of 1200px, use images that have at least this width. In other cases the images would lokking not very nice.
You can set here some important settings for a quick start!

You plan to create a full width slider. The slider has at the end the same width like the browser window. You can set here the width in pixels of you content width. In this case, you can place layers in the slide, that are catched to your page content border. Leave this empty, if you need the layers in full width too.
Set this option to use light controls in your slider.
Set this option to use dark controls in your slider.
Set this option to hide the controls in your slider.
Thumbnails on hover at the bottom navigation are shown for the slides
Dots Navigation is disabled on the bottom. Thumbnails are always visible.
Thumbnails on hover at the bottom navigation are hidden for the slides
You can set, how long at least one slide is visible. Default time is 4 seconds. This value is saved as millisonds. 1000 milliseconds = 1 second.
Here you can set, which effect for the slide changes is used. You can later use more effects and different for each slide. The keyword for this is "Transitions"!
Migration assistant for jQuery layerslider plugin

With this assistant you can easy integrate the jQuery Layerslider Plugin to this extension. Your downloaded ZIP file from CodeCanyon is very big, and because of limited upload sizes on many servers, this wizard show you a list of needed files from the ZIP of the plugin. For each file you see if it exist, and if not, you can use the Drag & Drop area below.
You can drag the complete layerslider folder from your downloaded ZIP file and single files too. The migration assistant knows every file and put it on the right place. If you upload a skin, please drag the complete skin folder or a single skin folder.
If you have downloaded a new version of the jquery layerslider plugin, you can use this migration assistent too.
Drop a single file or the whole layerslider folder here
All files uploaded. Drop a single file or the whole layerslider folder here to upload files again
Uploaded file is not equal to the expected target
This file is not allowed to upload
File not saved. Skin files have to uploaded only with their skin folder!
Copy this layer. Save the slider first!
Sort this layer (save slider after sorting!)
The name is used only for TYPO3 Backend
Select the content type of this layer. You can choose betwen different types
Link for this layer. Example: 'http://www.google.de'. Please note: links are rendered only in frontend!
The left position for this elemet from top/left corner. In responsive mode this value will be down-calculated by the sliders actual width value. You slider has a width value of %s pixel
The top position for this elemet from top/left corner. In responsive mode this value will be down-calculated by the sliders actual width value. You slider has a width value of %s pixel

The width for this element. You can use pixel value to set the width. In responsive mode this value will be down-calculated by the sliders actual width value. Your slider has a width value of %s pixel
Select one from the possible values: left, right, center, justify
Font size in pixels. The font size would be automatic down calculated
You can use HEX (#000000) or rgb (rgb(0,0,0)) or rgba (rgba(0,0,0,.5)) code
You can use HEX (#000000) or rgb (rgb(0,0,0)) or rgba (rgba(0,0,0,.5)) code
Border top.. You can use CSS standard like '1px solid #FFF'.
Border right. You can use CSS standard like '1px solid #FFF'.
Border bottom. You can use CSS standard like '1px solid #FFF'.
Border left. You can use CSS standard like '1px solid #FFF'.
You can use any further inline css styles on this element. Split each inline css code with a semikolon. Example: 'border-radius: 10px; -moz-border-radius: 10px;'
You can use an extra own css class. If you need more than one additional class, split the class names with a space.
Copy this slide. Save the slider first!
Sort this slide (save slider after sorting!)
The size of the slide background image. Use 'inherit' if you want to set it globally from the slider settings.
The position of the slide background image. Use 'inherit' if you want to set it globally from the slider settings.
The slide background color. You can use color names, hexadecimal, RGB or RGBA values.

The slide length in milliseconds. The slider will automatically determine the slide duration if you omit this option. Otherwise the slide will stay visible for the amount of time specified here. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.

We've made our pre-defined slide transitions with special care to fit in most use cases. However, if you would like to increase or decrease the speed of these transitions, you can override their timing here by providing your own transition length in milliseconds. (1 second = 1000 milliseconds)
Choose the type of the Ken Burns effect you would like to apply on the slide (if any).

Increase or decrease the size of the slide background image in the Ken Burns effect. The default value is 1, the value 2 will double the image, while 0.5 results half the size. Negative values will flip the image.
The amount of rotation (if any) in degrees used in the Ken Burns effect. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation.
The default value for parallax layers on this slide, which they will inherit, unless you set it otherwise on the affected layers.

You can trigger the parallax effect by either scrolling the page, or by moving your mouse cursor / tilting your mobile device. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.
Choose on which axes parallax layers should move. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center.

Controls the speed of animating layers when you move your mouse cursor or tilt your mobile device. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.

Controls how quickly your layers revert to their original position when you move your mouse cursor outside of a parallax slider. This value is in milliseconds. 1 second = 1000 milliseconds. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.

Increase or decrease the amount of layer movement when moving your mouse cursor or tilting on a mobile device. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.

Increase or decrease the amount of layer rotation in the 3D space when moving your mouse cursor or tilting on a mobile device. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them.
Changes the perspective of layers in the 3D space. This is the default value on the slide, which parallax layers will inherit, unless you set it otherwise directly on them. Default is 500
The name is used only for TYPO3 Backend

Here you can set the time interval between slide changes, this slide will stay visible for the time specified here. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second. Please don't use 0 or very low values.
You can choose between the old and the new 3D/2D slide transitions introduced in version 4.0.0.
Settings when 2D/3D transition is not used
The duration of the slide in animation. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.
Easing (type of transition) of the slide-in animation.
Easing (type of transition) of the slide-in animation.
The duration of the slide out animation. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.
Easing (type of transition) of the slide-out animation.
The duration of the delay out animation. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.
If you want to link the whole slide, enter the URL of your link here or use the link wizard.
You can apply an css attribute on the HTML element of this slide to work with it in your custom CSS or Javascript code.
You can specify a slide alias name which you can use in your URLs with a hash mark, so LayerSlider will start with the corresponding slide.

Important: If you manage layers with positioning with your mouse on this stage, you have to do this on a stage that represent the width and height from the original width and height from your slider. For the best results configure the slider as an responsive slider (default.) The measure of the stage is the same as you configured in the slider options under "width" and "height". In your best case, that "width" and "height" have the same dimensions as the background image for each slide!. If the area in the front-end is with an lower height and width, all elements would be placed with an corrected left/top value!

One or more layers in this slide have a longer time set, as the duration of this slide is. This means, that some effects on this layers are not visible or not working as expected. All green layers in the timeline should stop with the red slide duration! Check the layer animations like duration, delay or show until.

If you dont have any delays set, all layers starts the transition out, when the slide change starts. In that case you can ignore this warning.
Explicitly enables or disables using the Opening Transition.

Shifts the layer starting position from its original on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' position the layer out the staging area, so it enters the scene from either side when animating to its destination location.

Shifts the layer starting position from its original on the vertical axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'top' or 'bottom' position the layer out the staging area, so it enters the scene from either vertical side when animating to its destination location.
The length of the transition in milliseconds when the layer enters the scene. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.
Delays the transition with the given amount of milliseconds before the layer enters the scene. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.

The timing function of the animation. With this function you can manipulate the movement of the animated object. Please click on the link to open easings.net for more information and real-time examples.
Fade the layer during the transition.
Rotates the layer by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Scales the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.
Scales the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center, slidercenter, slidermiddle, slidertop, sliderright, sliderbottom, sliderleft.
Clips (cuts off) the sides of the layer by the given amount specified in pixels or percentages. The 4 value in order: top, right, bottom and the left side of the layer.
The background color of your layer. You can use color names, hexadecimal, RGB or RGBA values. Example: #FFF
The color of your text. You can use color names, hexadecimal, RGB or RGBA values. Example: #333
Sets the radius of rounded corners. Example: 5px
The initial width of this layer from which it will be animated to its proper size during the transition.
The initial height of this layer from which it will be animated to its proper size during the transition.
blur(5px) | brightness(40%) | contrast(200%) | grayscale(50%) | hue-rotate(90deg) | invert(75%) | saturate(30%) | sepia(60%)
Filters provide effects like blurring or color shifting your layers.
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.
Explicitly enables or disables using the Ending Transition.

Shifts the layer from its original position on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' animate the layer out the staging area, so it can leave the scene on either side.

Shifts the layer from its original position on the vertical axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'top' or 'bottom' animate the layer out the staging area, so it can leave the scene on either vertical side.
The length of the transition in milliseconds when the layer leaves the slide. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.
num slidechangeonly transitioninend textinstart textinend allinend loopstart loopend transitioninandloopend textinandloopend allinandloopend textoutstart textoutend textoutandloopend

Shifts the layer from its original position on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' animate the layer out the staging area, so it can leave the scene on either side.

The timing function of the animation. With this function you can manipulate the movement of the animated object. Please click on the link to open easings.net for more information and real-time examples.
Fade the layer during the transition.
Rotates the layer by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Scales the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.
Scales the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center, slidercenter, slidermiddle, slidertop, sliderright, sliderbottom, sliderleft.
Clips (cuts off) the sides of the layer by the given amount specified in pixels or percentages. The 4 value in order: top, right, bottom and the left side of the layer.
Animates the background toward the color you specify here when the layer leaves the slider canvas.
Animates the text color toward the color you specify here when the layer leaves the slider canvas.
Animates rounded corners toward the value you specify here when the layer leaves the slider canvas.
Animates the layer width toward the value you specify here when the layer leaves the slider canvas.
Animates the layer height toward the value you specify here when the layer leaves the slider canvas.
blur(5px) | brightness(40%) | contrast(200%) | grayscale(50%) | hue-rotate(90deg) | invert(75%) | saturate(30%) | sepia(60%)
Filters provide effects like blurring or color shifting your layers.
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.
Explicitly enables or disables the Parallax Transition.
Set the intensity of the parallax effect. Use negative values to shift layers in the opposite direction.
Choose if you want 2D or 3D parallax layers.
You can trigger the parallax effect by either scrolling the page, or by moving your mouse cursor / tilting your mobile device.
Choose on which axes parallax layers should move.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center.
Explicitly enables or disables using the Loop Transition.
num transitioninstart transitioninend textinstart textinend allinend
You can set the starting time of this transition.

Shifts the layer starting position from its original on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' position the layer out the staging area, so it can leave and re-enter the scene from either side during the transition.

Shifts the layer starting position from its original on the vertical axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'top' or 'bottom' position the layer out the staging area, so it can leave and re-enter the scene from either vertical side during the transition.
The length of the transition in milliseconds. A second is equal to 1000 milliseconds.
The timing function of the animation to manipualte the layer's movement.
Fades the layer. You can use values between 1 and 0 to set the layer fully opaque or transparent respectively. For example, the value 0.5 will make the layer semi-transparent.
Rotates the layer by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Scales the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.
Scales the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center, slidercenter, slidermiddle, slidertop, sliderright, sliderbottom, sliderleft.
Clips (cuts off) the sides of the layer by the given amount specified in pixels or percentages. The 4 value in order: top, right, bottom and the left side of the layer.

The number of times repeating the Loop transition. The count includes the reverse part of the transitions when you use the Yoyo feature. Use the value -1 to repeat infinitely or zero to disable looping.
Waiting time between repeats in milliseconds. A second is 1000 milliseconds.
Enable this option to allow reverse transition, so you can loop back and forth seamlessly.
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.
blur(5px) brightness(40%) contrast(200%) grayscale(50%) hue-rotate(90deg) invert(75%) saturate(30%) sepia(60%)
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.
Explicitly enables or disables the Hover Transition.
Moves the layer horizontally by the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction.
Moves the layer vertically by the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction.
The length of the transition in milliseconds. A second is equal to 1000 milliseconds.
The duration of the reverse transition in milliseconds. A second is equal to 1000 milliseconds.
The timing function of the animation to manipualte the layer's movement. Click on the link to open easings.net for examples and more information
The timing function of the reverse animation to manipualte the layer's movement. Click on the link to open easings.net for examples and more information
Fades the layer. You can use values between 1 and 0 to set the layer fully opaque or transparent respectively. For example, the value 0.5 will make the layer semi-transparent.
Rotates the layer clockwise by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Scales the layer along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.
Scales the layer along the Y (vertical) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks the layer compared to its original size.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Pixel and percentage values.
The background color of this layer. You can use color names, hexadecimal, RGB or RGBA values. Example: #FFF
The text color of this text. You can use color names, hexadecimal, RGB or RGBA values. Example: #333
If you want rounded corners, you can set here its radius in pixels. Example: 5px
Changes the perspective of layers in the 3D space.
Show this layer above every other layer while hovering.
Explicitly enables or disables using the Opening Text Transition.
num transitioninstart transitioninend loopstart loopend transitioninandloopend
You can set the starting time of this transition.
Select how your text should be split and animated.
Delays the transition of each text nodes relative to each other with the given amount of milliseconds. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.

Shifts the starting position of text nodes from their original on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' position text nodes out the staging area, so they enter the scene from either side when animating to their destination location. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Shifts the starting position of text nodes from their original on the vertical axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'top' or 'bottom' position text nodes out the staging area, so they enter the scene from either vertical side when animating to their destination location. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.
The transition length in milliseconds of the individual text fragments. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.

The timing function of the animation. With this function you can manipulate the movement of animated text fragments. Please click on the link to open easings.net for more information and real-time examples.
Fade the text fragments during their transition.

Rotates text fragments clockwise by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Rotates text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Rotates text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Scales text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks text fragments compared to their original size. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Scales text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks text fragments compared to their original size. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Skews text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Skews text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center, slidercenter, slidermiddle, slidertop, sliderright, sliderbottom, sliderleft.
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.
Explicitly enables or disables using the Ending Text Transition.
num transitioninend textinstart textinend allinend loopstart loopend transitioninandloopend textinandloopend allinandloopend
You can set the starting time of this transition.
Select how your text should be split and animated.
Delays the transition of each text nodes relative to each other. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.

Shifts the ending position of text nodes from their original on the horizontal axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'left' or 'right' position text nodes out the staging area, so they leave the scene from either side when animating to their destination location. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Shifts the ending position of text nodes from their original on the vertical axis with the given number of pixels. Use negative values for the opposite direction. The values 'top' or 'bottom' position text nodes out the staging area, so they leave the scene from either vertical side when animating to their destination location. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.
The transition length in milliseconds of the individual text fragments. A second equals to 1000 milliseconds.

The timing function of the animation. With this function you can manipulate the movement of animated text fragments. Please click on the link to open easings.net for more information and real-time examples.
Fade the text fragments during their transition.

Rotates text fragments clockwise by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for counterclockwise rotation. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Rotates text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Rotates text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Scales text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks text fragments compared to their original size. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Scales text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the specified vector. Use the value 1 for the original size. The value 2 will double, while 0.5 shrinks text fragments compared to their original size. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Skews text fragments along the X (horizontal) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Skews text fragments along the Y (vertical) axis by the given number of degrees. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction. By listing multiple values separated with a | character, the slider will use different transition variations on each text node by cycling between the provided values.

Sets a point on canvas from which transformations are calculated. For example, a layer may rotate around its center axis or a completely custom point, such as one of its corners. The three values represent the X, Y and Z axes in 3D space. Apart from the pixel and percentage values, you can also use the following constants: top, right, bottom, left, center, slidercenter, slidermiddle, slidertop, sliderright, sliderbottom, sliderleft.
Changes the perspective of this layer in the 3D space.

You can keep the layer on top of the slider across multiple slides. Just select the slide on which a layer should animate out. Alternatively, you can make this layer global on all slides after it transitioned in.
A Play by Scroll slider will pause when this layer finished its opening transition.
The minimum font size in a responsive slider. This option allows you to prevent your texts layers becoming too small on smaller screens.
The minimum font size in a responsive slider on mobile devices. This option allows you to prevent your texts layers becoming too small on smaller screens.

Sets the layer position origin from which top and left values are calculated. The default is the upper left corner of the slider canvas. In a full width and full size slider, your content is centered based on the screen size to achieve the best possible fit. By selecting the "sides of the screen" option in those scenarios, you can allow layers to escape the centered inner area and stick to the sides of the screen.
Select one from the possible slide in horizontal directions
Select one from the possible slide in vertical directions
The duration of the slide in animation. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second. Lower values results faster animations.
Easing (type of transition) of the slide-in animation
Delay before the animation start when the layer slides in. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.
Rotates the layer clockwise from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for anticlockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction
Scales the layer's width from the given value to its original size. Range between 0 and 1 are allowed (0.2)
Scales the layer's height from the given value to its original size. Range between 0 and 1 are allowed (0.2)
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) axis from the given angle to 0 degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) axis from the given angle to 0 degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Select one from the possible slide out horizontal directions
Select one from the possible slide out vertical directions
The duration of the slide in animation. This value is in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second. Lower values results faster animations.
Easing (type of transition) of the slide-out animation.
Rotates the layer clockwise from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for anticlockwise rotation.
Rotates the layer along the X (horizontal) axis from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Rotates the layer along the Y (vertical) axis from the given angle to zero degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Scales the layer's width from the given value to its original size. Range between 0 and 1 are allowed (0.2)
Scales the layer's height from the given value to its original size. Range between 0 and 1 are allowed (0.2)
Skews the layer along the X (horizontal) axis from the given angle to 0 degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.
Skews the layer along the Y (vertical) axis from the given angle to 0 degree. Negative values are allowed for reverse direction.

The default value is -1 which means that the layer will be positioned exactly outside of the slide container. You can use the default setting in most of the cases. If you need to set the start or end position of the layer from further of the edges of the slide container, you can use 2, 3 or higher values.

The layer will be visible for the time you specify here, then it will slide out. You can use this setting for layers to leave the slide before the slide itself animates out, or for example before other layers will slide in. This value in millisecs, so the value 1000 means 1 second.
Nice feature to create a fancy parallax effect by moving your mouse over the slider. You can use both positive or negative values (for opposite directions).
Please add at first a Slide image. Then save the slider and come back to this page. After save you can add new layers to this slide.

You can see all the available 2D & 3D transitions in the list below. Please move your mouse over the names of the transitions and you will see a real-time preview of the selected transition. Click on each transition for use in this slide. Please note, that not all browsers are compatible with CSS3 3D transitions. You can use 3D transitions with the latest version of Chrome (except on Win XP), Firefox, Safari, and soon with Opera, and of course with the CSS3 3D capable mobile browsers. In all other browsers the slider will switch into a 2D fallback mode.
Name of the slider. Save the slider after your input. You will be redirected to manage the slider.
The following settings are inheritable by certain options and can be set globally if they choose to use inheritance.
number (in pixels like 1280px or in percent like 100%). Default: 1280px
The width of the slider. For best results set this to the width of your slide image width's and use the slider with the option "responsive (default on)".
The height of the slider. For best results set this to the height of your slide image height's and use the slider with the option "responsive (default on)".

The layout mode for sliders. See fullSizeMode and other options for additional settings and customization options.

Responsive The slider will automatically use the available space to fill its container by proportionally scaling itself up or down based on the parent container width. Use the CSS min-width or max-width properties on the slider container to set an upper or lower limit.

Fixed size The slider will *not* be resized at all in any case.

Full width Edge to edge full width mode. The slider can break out from its containment element if your site uses a boxed layout. Your layers will be centered within the slider without upscaling, empty space at the sides of the slider will be covered by the slider/slide background. Downscaling starts at the initial slider width by default, but your can override it with the responsiveUnder option.

Full size
  • Normal: Your slider will always be the same size as the browser viewport, even after resizing. Slider content will be automatically upscaled or downscaled to fit perfectly to the available space on the site. Sliders can break out from their bounding elements if not placed correctly.
  • Hero scene: Hero scene sliders act similarly as normal full size ones, except they will reduce their height by their scrollTop values. They should be used at the top of your page. They are ideal to perfectly fill the browser window when scrolled to the top, even if page headers and menu bars would otherwise push them down a bit.
  • Fit to height: Follows the height of the parent element and resizes the slider proportionally to fit its bounding element.
Slider gets responsive, if the width of the window gets under this value. If you use this, please seaktivate the responsive option!
Select the sizing behavior of your full size sliders (e.g. hero scene).
If enabled, the slider will always have the same width as the viewport, even if a theme uses a boxed layout, unless you choose the "Fit to parent height" full size mode.
Visitors can enter OS native full-screen mode when double clicking on the slider.
The slider will not enlarge your layers above the target ratio. For example, the value 1 will keep your layers in their initial size, without any upscaling.
Move your slider to a different part of the page by providing a jQuery DOM manipulation method and selector for the target destination.
Move your slider to a different part of the page by providing a jQuery DOM manipulation method and selector for the target destination. Example: body or #mydiv
Choose on which axis (if any) you want to clip the overflowing content (i.e. that breaks outside of the slider bounds).
Ensures that the site template cannot clip parts of the slider when used in a boxed layout.
Hides the slider on mobile devices, including tablets.
Hides the slider when the viewport width goes under the specified value.
Ignore selected slide transitions and use sliding effects only when users are changing slides with a swipe on mobile devices.
Enable optimizations on mobile devices to avoid performance issues (e.g. fewer tiles in slide transitions, reducing performance-heavy effects with very similar results, etc).
LayerSlider will begin with this layer. Use the word 'random' to start with a random layer.
If on, slideshow will automatically start after loading the page.
The slider will start when it enters into the viewport.
If on, SlideShow will pause when you move the mouse pointer over the LayerSlider container.
If you enable this option, layer transitions will not start playing until the slideshow is in a paused state.
Keyboard navigation. You can navigate with the left and right arrow keys.
Play the slider by scrolling your mouse wheel.
Set the playing speed of Play by Scroll like 1
Number of cycles if slideshow is enabled.
The slider will always stop at the given number of cycles, even if the slideshow restarts.
If on, slideshow will go backwards if you click the prev button.
The slideshow will proceed in random order.

You can change the skin of the Slider. You can choose one of the pre-installed skin on the list or type a own skin name in. The skin name represents the folder where the skin files are located. If you choose a own skin you have set 'skinsPath' manually!

Pre-installed skins:
You can change the default path of the skins folder. Example: /fileadmin/templates/skins/
The duration of the fade transition (in ms) when the slider is showing up for the first time on page load.
Background color of LayerSlider. You can use all CSS methods, like hexa colors, rgb(r,g,b) method, color names, etc. Note, that background sublayers are covering the background.
URL of the background image. Default: false
Background image of LayerSlider. This will be a fixed background image of LayerSlider by default. Note, that background sublayers are covering the global background image.
Choose between a scrollable or fixed global background image.
Global background image position of the slider. The first value is the horizontal position and the second value is the vertical.
Global background size of the slider. You can set the size in pixels, percentages, or constants: auto | cover | contain
If off, Prev and Next buttons will be invisible.
If off, Start and Stop buttons will be invisible.
If off, slide buttons will be invisible.
If on, the prev and next buttons will be shown only if you move your mouse over the slider.
If on, the bottom navigation controls (with also thumbnails) will be shown only if you move your mouse over the slider.
You can show or hide the bar timer.
You can show or hide the circle timer.
You can grab the slidebar timer playhead and seek the whole slide real-time like a movie.
Thumbnail navigation mode. Can be 'disabled', 'hover', 'always'. Note, that 'hover' setting needs navButtons true!
Default width of the thumbnail container, for example: 100 (pixels) or 60%
number (in pixels, a positive integer). Default: 100
number (in pixels, a positive integer). Default: 60
number (0 or a positive integer lower, than 100). Default: 35
number (0 or a positive integer lower, than 100). Default: 100
If on, slider will autoplay youtube / vimeo videos - you can use it with autoPauseSlideshow.

auto, on or off. 'auto' means, if autoPlayVideos is set to on, slideshow will stop UNTIL the video is playing and after that it continues. True means slideshow will stop and it won't continue after video is played.
Default thumbnail picture of YouTube videos. Can be 'maxresdefault.jpg', 'hqdefault.jpg', 'mqdefault.jpg' or 'default.jpg'. Note, that 'maxresdefault.jpg' os not available to all (not HD) videos.
A fixed image layer can be shown above the slider that remains still throughout the whole slider. Can be used to display logos or watermarks.
CSS properties to control the image placement and appearance.
Enter a URL to link the YourLogo image.
Choose whether you want to open the link in the current or on a new tab.
The default slide background image size. This will be used as a default on all slides, unless you choose to explicitly override it on a per slide basis.
The default slide background image position. This will be used as a default on all slides, unless you choose the explicitly override it on a per slide basis.
Increase or decrease the sensitivity of parallax content when moving your mouse cursor or tilting your mobile device.
Choose a center point for parallax content where all layers will be aligned perfectly according to their original position.
Provide a comfortable holding position (in degrees) for mobile devices, which should be the center point for parallax content where all layers should align perfectly.
Your parallax layers will move to the opposite direction when scrolling the page.
The animation speed in milliseconds when the slider forces remaining layers out of scene before swapping slides.

Certain transformation and transition options cannot be updated on the fly when the browser size or device orientation changes. By enabling, the slider will automatically detect such situations and will restart the current slider to preserve its appearance.

The srcset attribute allows loading dynamically scaled images based on screen resolution. It can save bandwidth and allow using retina-ready images on high resolution devices. If not configured correctly, srcsets might also cause blurry images in some edge cases.
If on, LayerSlider will change to a random layer instead of changing to the next / prev layer. Note that 'loops' feature won't work with randomSlideshow!
Image preload. Preloads all images and background-images of the next layer.
number (0 or a positive integer). Default: 0
Number of loops if autoStart set true (0 means infinite).
If true, the slider will always stop at the given number of loops even if the user restarts the slideshow.

You can change the skin of the Slider. You can choose one of the pre-installed skin on the list or type a own skin name in. The skin name represents the folder where the skin files are located. If you choose a own skin you have set 'skinsPath' manually!

Pre-installed skins:

Slide direction. New layers sliding FROM(!) this direction.
* From version 1.6 you can use the fade parameter if you want to fade in / out a sublayer instead of sliding. Note, that fade is working ONLY on sublayers but not on layers so if you want to fade in / out a sublayer (instead of sliding), you have to add the slidedirection or the slideoutdirection property to that sublayer and you cannot use fade as a global property
Delay time of the slide-in animation.
Delay time of the slide-out animation.
easing (all easing types of jQuery UI Effects Core can be used) Default: easeInOutQuint

Easing (type of transition) of the slide-in animation.
You can click here to view all easing types: Easings jQuery UI API
easing (all easing types of jQuery UI Effects Core can be used) Default: easeInOutQuint

Easing (type of transition) of the slide-out animation.
You can click here to view all easing types: Easings jQuery UI API
If set, the slider will make a responsive width container.
This is the preview area of your slider. The Black border is not part of this slider, it demonstrates only border of the slider room.
Set the width of the preview panel to this size:
Error on select this File. Please try another image.
Error on select this File. Please try another image.
The given Slider was not found
Are you sure you want to delete "%s"? This action can not be undone.
Place the timeline selector in the light green area to move this element. While the element is in transition, you can't move it!
